questions.question: What does 'GI/M/1/N' represent in the context of queueing theory?

answers.d: General arrival distribution /Markovian service /Single server/Finite capacity

explanations.a: Incorrect. This option does not represent the correct notation for the GI/M/1/N queueing model.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This option does not accurately represent the notation for the GI/M/1/N queueing model.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This option does not accurately represent the notation for the GI/M/1/N queueing model.
explanations.d: Correct. 'GI/M/1/N' represents General arrival distribution /Markovian service /Single server/Finite capacity in the context of queueing theory.

questions.question: In the GI/M/1/N queueing model, what does 'M' represent?

explanations.a: Incorrect. 'M' does not represent the maximum number of customers in the GI/M/1/N model.
explanations.b: Incorrect. 'M' represents the mean arrival rate in the GI/M/1/N queueing model.
explanations.c: Correct. 'M' represents the service time follows Markovian distribution in the GI/M/1/N model.
explanations.d: Incorrect. 'M' does not represent the maximum queue capacity in the GI/M/1/N model.

questions.question: In the GI/M/1/N queueing model, what does 'N' represent?

explanations.a: Incorrect. 'N' does not represent the number of servers in the GI/M/1/N model.
explanations.b: Incorrect. 'N' does not represent the number of arrivals in the GI/M/1/N model.
explanations.c: Correct. 'N' represents the maximum queue capacity in the GI/M/1/N queueing model.
explanations.d: Incorrect. 'N' does not represent the mean service rate in the GI/M/1/N model.

questions.question: What kind of distribution characterizes the arrival process in the GI/M/1/N queueing model?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Uniform distribution does not characterize the arrival process in the GI/M/1/N model.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Exponential distribution does not characterize the arrival process in the GI/M/1/N model.
explanations.c: Correct. General distribution characterizes the arrival process in the GI/M/1/N queueing model.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Normal distribution does not characterize the arrival process in the GI/M/1/N model.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the mean arrival rate and mean service rate for the existence of a steady-state solution?

answers.a: Mean arrival rate = Mean service rate
answers.b: Mean arrival rate > Mean service rate
answers.c: Mean arrival rate < Mean service rate
answers.d: Mean service rate is independent of mean arrival rate for the existence of steady-state solution

explanations.a: For mean arrival rate equals to mean service rate, traffic intensity equals to 1, which leads an infinite number of customers in the system
explanations.b: In this case, the system will collapse due to more arrival in comparison to service in a unit time
explanations.c: This leads to steady-state solution as arrivals are less than service in a unit time
explanations.d: In this case, the system will collapse due to more arrivals in comparison to service in a unit time when the arrival rate becomes greater than service rate
